channel.title: New idea. Don't steal
channel.description:
[img]http://img210.imageshack.us/img210/8584/disclaimeruf6.jpg[/img]
My new disclaimer picture.
I made it for people who post tuts, a lot.
I didn't post it in the graphics section because this was probably one of the most noobish gfx ever. Just some brush and outer glow.
Tell me what you think of the idea though. It kind of shows people's dedication to writing tuts with idiotic ideas (remembers my beheading tut =)

item.title: New idea. Don't steal
item.dc:creator: @Buzzy Buzzy
item.description:
@Buzzy wrote:

[quote=“xxlegitxx, post:20, topic:141005”][quote author=Buzzy link=topic=193235.msg1737911#msg1737911 date=1189213758]
Lmfao. What’s wrong with you?

The disclaimer is more protection than none, and MOST of the tuts people are writing this days, would be protected from a disclaimer.
[/quote]

If someone dies from something you wrote, believe me, a disclaimer will not protect you from being prosecuted and/or sued.

As for the CSS thing, it’s simply because I think that yes, it’s over taught one, and two, it’s very capable to make one with out it, considering it only got on the mainstream scene for about… 4-5 years now? And websites looked great without it.

Let me present another analogy, because apparently you can’t relate to hookers. HTML without CSS is like sex without a condom; it’s easier, but expect consequences. HTML was built for content, not layout. Not design. Not for background colors or font. Content. CSS was specifically created for design. Of course sites looked great without it, because they didn’t comply with standards, and neither did web browsers. Now, XHTML is the craze. If you want to build a site with longevity and flexibiilty, you go with standards. It’s stupid otherwise. CSS is much more powerful and effective than HTML design ever was and ever will be. Your favorite HTML tags will come and go (blink is gone, and font will be too), but CSS will more or less be constant except for additions.[/quote]

That is a great analogy.

I actually think I’ll check some tutorials on it. Sorry I couldn’t relate to hookers, I just don’t use them.

Read full topic

item.title: New idea. Don't steal
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

[quote=“Buzzy, post:19, topic:141005”]Lmfao. What’s wrong with you?

The disclaimer is more protection than none, and MOST of the tuts people are writing this days, would be protected from a disclaimer.[/quote]

If someone dies from something you wrote, believe me, a disclaimer will not protect you from being prosecuted and/or sued.

Buzzy:

As for the CSS thing, it’s simply because I think that yes, it’s over taught one, and two, it’s very capable to make one with out it, considering it only got on the mainstream scene for about… 4-5 years now? And websites looked great without it.

Let me present another analogy, because apparently you can’t relate to hookers. HTML without CSS is like sex without a condom; it’s easier, but expect consequences. HTML was built for content, not layout. Not design. Not for background colors or font. Content. CSS was specifically created for design. Of course sites looked great without it, because they didn’t comply with standards, and neither did web browsers. Now, XHTML is the craze. If you want to build a site with longevity and flexibiilty, you go with standards. It’s stupid otherwise. CSS is much more powerful and effective than HTML design ever was and ever will be. Your favorite HTML tags will come and go (blink is gone, and font will be too), but CSS will more or less be constant except for additions.

Read full topic

item.title: New idea. Don't steal
item.dc:creator: @Buzzy Buzzy
item.description:
@Buzzy wrote:

[quote=“xxlegitxx, post:18, topic:141005”][quote author=Buzzy link=topic=193235.msg1737114#msg1737114 date=1189158213]
All the tut writers know, write a disclaimer when writing stupid shit, or there’s a small chance you get sued.
[/quote]

And all the lawyers know, having a disclaimer does not necessarily indemnify or protect.

I refuse to learn css, because I think that it has been over taught by little fucking skem9 myspace faggots.

So HTML is the only markup language used on the web. ‘Oh noes! Overtaught!’ No, faggot. HTML without CSS is like a hooker without makeup. The real reason (spoilers!) is because you’re a lazy fruitcake.[/quote]

Lmfao. What’s wrong with you?

The disclaimer is more protection than none, and MOST of the tuts people are writing this days, would be protected from a disclaimer.

As for the CSS thing, it’s simply because I think that yes, it’s over taught one, and two, it’s very capable to make one with out it, considering it only got on the mainstream scene for about… 4-5 years now? And websites looked great without it.

Read full topic

item.title: New idea. Don't steal
item.dc:creator: @Buzzy Buzzy
item.description:
@Buzzy wrote:

[quote=“Monster Hack, post:12, topic:141005”]Just to clear up…“Sprays for CSS” - Spray for Counter-Strike: Source xD
So this is just for you tutorials? You said people who post a lot of tuts, but just wondering…If its a disclaimer for everyone, why did you sign it?
It should be from the community. Correct me if I’m mistaken.

-Mh[/quote]

Oh no, people will make it either way. This is just my version. I just ask that people don’t say that this was their idea.

[quote=“ninja nub, post:13, topic:141005”]Yea monsters right - lol - and either way I do know CSS game and CSS code. :P[br][size=1]Posted on: September 06, 2007, 11:05:15 PM[/size][hr]Heres pic, I had really cool one but it on different computer >.<

Yea, I was bored on Paint

and heres an ok - my photoshop ones ill show later

[/quote]

I lawld like crazy =)

item.dc:creator: @Buzzy Buzzy
item.description:
@Buzzy wrote:

nade:

There is no angle where this does not look gay and a prove your a faggot.

Lmfao.

Thanks Nade. I still lubs j00 tho.

[quote=“3.65 kilos, post:7, topic:141005”]Well…HTML and CSS go hand in hand. But yeah, I know what you’re saying. Tbh, I started in Web Design because of myspace.

Oh, about your disclaimer: Seems fairly straight-forward. I don’t like how it’s so dark though. (I’m more of a “blue” person)[/quote]
Which isn’t a bad thing, I just don’t personally like it.

[quote=“marluxia, post:8, topic:141005”][quote author=Buzzy link=topic=193235.msg1737105#msg1737105 date=1189157861]
Lol. It’s not that I don’t think that CSS is a good language, I just don’t like the fact that because of MySpace, it’s probably now the biggest copied web language next to html.
[/quote]

anyways back on topic, this disclaimer is pointless[/quote]
I guess your not a tut writer.

All the tut writers know, write a disclaimer when writing stupid shit, or there’s a small chance you get sued.

Some people, who write a lot of tuts, make their own personal disclaimers, just text, nothing more.

I just stepped it up a notch =)

Read full topic
